issues.description: Problem statement UML diagram indicates that the Animal class’s name attribute is of type String, but the narrative instructions immediately afterward tell students to use StringBuilder for the same attribute. This inner-specification contradiction will confuse students about which type to choose when defining Animal.name.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the specification by choosing a single type for Animal.name. Either change the UML diagram to show StringBuilder or remove/adjust the narrative instruction about StringBuilder so both agree on using String.

issues.description: The reference solution implements Animal.name as a String (private String name), which directly conflicts with the problem statement’s instruction to use StringBuilder for that attribute. Students following the narrative requirement would end up with a different type than shown in the solution, potentially breaking tests or causing confusion.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution with the narrative by changing the Animal.name field to StringBuilder (and updating constructor, getter, and setter accordingly), or remove the narrative requirement so that both spec and solution use String.
